Container.Name: dupeGuru
Container.Overview: dupeGuru is a tool to find duplicate files on your computer. It can scan either filenames or contents. The filename scan features a fuzzy matching algorithm that can find duplicate filenames even when they are not exactly the same.[br][br]The graphical user interface (GUI) is accessible through a modern web browser or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB).

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This is where files and folders on your host are made available to dupeGuru.<br> Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Trash
Config.Description: This is where dupeGuru moves files when they are sent to trash. This can be removed if a trash is not wanted (i.e. if you want files to be permanently deleted).<br> Container path: /trash

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width, in pixels, of dupeGuru's application window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height, in pixels, of dupeGuru's application window.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user dupeGuru runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group dupeGuru runs as.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where dupeGuru stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br> Container path: /config

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the dupeGuru GUI with a web browser.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the dupeGuru GUI with VNC client.<br> Make sure this port is equal to the WEB GUI port + 100.
